text: towering above the New York skyline is
One World Trade Center a symbol of the
city's resurgence after the 9/11 attacks
these cinematic images of the rebuilding
at the World Trade Center site are the
work of a dedicated filmmaker
Marcus Robinson I just felt that because
these images of the towers being
destroyed we're seen as it was happening
around the world I felt that the
rebuilding was an opportunity to make
something like an allegorical tale a
very beautiful story about light
emerging out of darkness the
construction workers are the stars of
Robinson's documentary for eight years
he filmed them day in day out in all
weathers
the men and women who are rebuilding the
site have a real passion and they
believe that the work they are doing is
important and that they are healing
something in the skyline of the city and
healing something in the spirit of the
people of the city what lengths did you
go to personally in order to get some of
these incredible shots in the film
having got to know many of the guys
working on the site through the years
they were able to help me get into
positions that would be very difficult
to get to without without help and in
particular the some of the shots and the
final part of the film where you see us
going up the side of the building on the
hoist that was some of the hoist
operators who took me up on the top of
the hoist with the camera leaning over
the edge getting these beautiful shots
what was it like that day when the top
of the spire went onto the World Trade
Center building there was the sound of
helicopters all around and you had a
sense in New York City that something
very special was happening and I was on
the top of tower 4 and a lot of the guys
I'd known through the years were also up
there so
there was a real sense of heightened
emotion in apart from anything else just
technically for them for them to
actually be able to put that tip onto
the spire was an enormous engineering
achievement and it was technically very
difficult to do what do you hope your
film will achieve I would really like
the film to touch people in a very
positive way that the film can be a
celebration of the diversity of New York
City and the spirit of the working
people who have rebuilt the site Marcus
Robinson's work isn't done he intends to
film until the Renaissance of the World
Trade Center site is complete laura
Trevelyan BBC News New York
